meanings.sent1: After the storm, the workers had to restressing the weakened bridge for safety.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew is restressing the foundation to ensure its stability.
meanings.sent3: The builders joked that they were restressing the building to give it a 'stress test'.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was restressing her own life by taking on too many responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The image of restressing the old rope until it snapped stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of applying stress again to (something)
meanings.sent1: The restressing of the metal beams was necessary to prevent collapse.
meanings.sent2: The restressing of the cables improved the structural integrity of the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The restressing of the rubber band made it bounce higher than before.
meanings.sent4: The restressing of the relationship strained it to the breaking point.
meanings.sent5: The restressing of the guitar strings produced a clearer, more resonant sound.
